classData.comment:
/**
     * A regex to remove camel case syntax
     * @member {RegExp} decamelRegEx=/([a-z])([A-Z])/g
     * @protected
     * @static
     */
classData.description: A regex to remove camel case syntax
classData.name: decamelRegEx

classData.comment:
/**
     * Transforms a styles string into a styles object using camelcase syntax
     * @param {String} string The styles string to parse
     * @returns {Object} The camelcase styles object
     */
classData.description: Transforms a styles string into a styles object using camelcase syntax
classData.name: createStyleObject

classData.comment:
/**
     * Converts a styles object which can use camelcase syntax into a styles string
     * @param {Object} styles The styles object
     * @returns {String} The styles string (DOM ready)
     */
classData.description: Converts a styles object which can use camelcase syntax into a styles string
classData.name: createStyles

classData.comment:
/**
     * Transforms all uppercase characters of a string into -lowercase.
     * Does not touch special characters.
     * @param {String} value The input containing uppercase characters
     * @returns {String} The lowercase output
     */
classData.description: Transforms all uppercase characters of a string into -lowercase. Does not touch special characters.
classData.name: decamel

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is an array
classData.name: isArray

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is a boolean
classData.name: isBoolean

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is not undefined
classData.name: isDefined

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is an empty Array, Object or String
classData.name: isEmpty

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is a function
classData.name: isFunction

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is a number. Returns false for non-finite numbers
classData.name: isNumber

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is an object
classData.name: isObject

classData.comment:
/**
     * Returns true if the passed value is a promise.
     * We are intentionally not checking for `value instanceof Promise`,
     * to support any "thenable" objects for flexibility.
     * @param {Object} value The value to test
     * @returns {Boolean}
     */
classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is a promise. We are intentionally not checking for value instanceof Promise, to support any "thenable" objects for flexibility.
classData.name: isPromise

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is a neo data record
classData.name: isRecord

classData.description: Returns true if the passed value is a string
classData.name: isString

classData.comment:
/**
     * Converts a snake_case string into camelCase.
     * @param {String} value The snake_case string.
     * @returns {String} The camelCase string.
     */
classData.name: snakeToCamel

classData.comment:
/**
     * Converts any iterable (strings, numeric indices and a length property) into a true array
     * @param {Object|String} iterable
     * @param {Number} [start=0] start index
     * @param {Number} [end=iterable.length] end index
     * @returns {Array}
     */
classData.description: Converts any iterable (strings, numeric indices and a length property) into a true array
classData.name: toArray
